john-langford.title: Detail research highlights
john-langford.why: Add context on contextual bandits and learning reductions.
john-langford.reference: A typical Research section briefly outlines key areas (e.g., contextual bandits, learning reductions), describes notable algorithms or frameworks, and cites reliable secondary sources. Keep a neutral tone, link core topics, and avoid promotional language.
john-langford.example:
Research highlights
- Areas: learning reductions; contextual bandits
- Contributions: scalable online learning; open-source systems
- Impact: applications in industry and academia
john-langford.content: Langford's research spans learning reductions and contextual bandits, focusing on practical algorithms for interactive learning settings.<ref name=wikiJL>https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Langford_(scientist)</ref> He has contributed to efficient large‑scale learning systems and online learning frameworks.<ref name=vw>https://vowpalwabbit.org/</ref> His applied work bridges theory and production ML systems at industrial research labs.<ref name=msrNYC>https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/research/lab/microsoft-research-new-york/</ref>

eduardo-caianiello.title: Education
eduardo-caianiello.why: Add academic background and early training.
eduardo-caianiello.reference: Education sections typically list degrees in chronological order with institution, field, and year (when verifiable). Include thesis title/advisor where notable, and cite institutional pages or reliable biographies.
eduardo-caianiello.example:
Education
- B.S., Institution — Field (Year)
- M.S., Institution — Field (Year)
- Ph.D., Institution — Field (Year) — Thesis: ‘Title’ (Advisor: Name)
eduardo-caianiello.content: Caianiello studied physics in Naples and completed advanced training that oriented his work toward theoretical physics and cybernetics.<ref name=wikiERC>https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eduardo_R._Caianiello</ref> Early fellowships and collaborations in Europe helped shape his interest in information processing and neural models.<ref name=treccani>https://www.treccani.it/enciclopedia/</ref>

eduardo-caianiello.title: Career
eduardo-caianiello.reference: Career sections summarize positions and appointments in chronological order (institution, role, dates). Highlight milestones and programs founded; avoid exhaustive CV lists. Each statement should be supported by reliable sources.
eduardo-caianiello.example:
Career
- 19XX–19XX — Professor of X, University Y
- 19XX–19XX — Director, Research Program Z
- 20XX–present — Senior role, Institution W
eduardo-caianiello.content: He held professorships in theoretical physics and helped develop cybernetics research programs in Italy.<ref name=wikiERC/> He worked within national research bodies to promote interdisciplinary studies spanning physics and computation.<ref name=cnr>https://www.cnr.it/</ref>

sources.name: CNR — National Research Council of Italy

eduardo-caianiello.title: Research contributions
eduardo-caianiello.why: Outline core scientific results and impact.
eduardo-caianiello.reference: This section typically explains main contributions at a high level, connects them to the broader field, and cites secondary over primary sources. Include terms that have standalone pages and avoid technical derivations.
eduardo-caianiello.example:
Research contributions
Brief overview paragraph describing key theoretical results and their significance to neural networks/cybernetics, followed by 2–3 bullet points:
- Concept A — short impact note
- Concept B — short impact note
eduardo-caianiello.content: Caianiello proposed early formal models of neural activity and memory, contributing to the foundations of neural networks and cybernetics.<ref name=wikiERC/> His theoretical work introduced equations and frameworks that influenced later computational neuroscience and AI research.<ref name=natureNN>https://www.nature.com/subjects/neural-networks</ref>

eduardo-caianiello.title: Selected publications
eduardo-caianiello.why: List major works for further reading.
eduardo-caianiello.reference: Use a bulleted list of representative, peer‑reviewed works with full citations (authors, year, title, venue, publisher or DOI). Prefer secondary coverage for commentary; limit the list to key items.
eduardo-caianiello.example:
Selected publications
- Author, A. (Year). Title. Journal/Conference. DOI: 10.xxxx/xxxx
- Author, A. (Year). Title. Publisher/Proceedings.
eduardo-caianiello.content: Key works address theoretical models of memory and information processing in neural systems.<ref name=wikiERC/> Representative publications illustrate the evolution from foundational concepts in cybernetics to early neural network theory.<ref name=scholar>https://scholar.google.com/</ref>

patrick-mchale.title: Awards
patrick-mchale.reference: An Awards section lists notable wins and nominations with year, awarding body, work (if applicable), and citation. Use reliable sources; group multiple items by award where helpful.
patrick-mchale.example:
Awards
- 20XX — Award Name (Category) — Work/Project
- 20XX — Nomination — Awarding Body
patrick-mchale.content: McHale and projects he led have received industry recognition, including major television and animation awards.<ref name=wikiPM>https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Patrick_McHale</ref> His work has been acknowledged for creative direction, storytelling, and music integration.<ref name=emmys>https://www.emmys.com/</ref>

patrick-mchale.title: Personal life
patrick-mchale.reference: Personal life content should be brief, relevant, and well‑sourced, following WP:BLP. Avoid trivia and unsourced material; include only verifiable facts covered by reliable sources.
patrick-mchale.example:
Personal life
One or two neutral sentences about background or residence with citations; avoid unsourced or overly detailed private information.
patrick-mchale.content: Publicly available profiles note personal background relevant to his creative career; only material with reliable sourcing should be included.<ref name=wikiPM/> Biographical details are limited to what is verifiable and non‑intrusive per living persons policy.<ref name=blp>https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Biographies_of_living_persons</ref>

henri-gouraud.title: Publications
henri-gouraud.reference: List seminal, peer‑reviewed papers with full bibliographic details. Optionally add a brief note on significance with secondary sourcing rather than self‑citation.
henri-gouraud.example:
Publications
- Author, H. (Year). Paper title on shading. Conference/Journal. DOI
- Author, H. (Year). Paper title on rendering. Venue.
henri-gouraud.content: Gouraud's work on smooth shading of curved surfaces introduced an interpolation technique that became a standard in 3D graphics.<ref name=wikiHG>https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gouraud_shading</ref> His publications from the early 1970s document methods that improved realism while remaining computationally efficient.<ref name=utahCHPC>https://www.cs.utah.edu/</ref>

henri-gouraud.title: Career
henri-gouraud.reference: Summarize institutional affiliations, roles, and dates in order. Include notable projects and collaborations with citations to independent sources.
henri-gouraud.example:
Career
- 19XX–19XX — Researcher, Institution (Project)
- 19XX–20XX — Faculty/Industry role, Institution
henri-gouraud.content: He contributed to the formative years of computer graphics research, working with institutions known for graphics innovation.<ref name=wikiHG2>https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Henri_Gouraud_(computer_scientist)</ref> His career highlights center on rendering techniques that influenced hardware and software pipelines.<ref name=acmDL>https://dl.acm.org/</ref>

katie-bouman.title: Selected publications
katie-bouman.reference: Provide a concise list of representative, peer‑reviewed publications with full citations and DOIs where available. Avoid exhaustive lists; prefer items covered by secondary sources.
katie-bouman.example:
Selected publications
- Bouman, K. et al. (Year). Paper title on computational imaging. Journal/Conference. DOI
- Bouman, K. et al. (Year). Paper title on inverse problems. Venue.
katie-bouman.content: Bouman's publications cover computational imaging and inverse problems, including work associated with the Event Horizon Telescope.<ref name=caltechKB>https://www.katiebouman.caltech.edu/</ref> Selected papers highlight methods for robust image reconstruction and multi‑modal sensing.<ref name=scholarKB>https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=0nJfPY0AAAAJ</ref>

katie-bouman.title: Professional affiliations
katie-bouman.reference: Affiliations sections typically state current and past institutions, departments, and collaborative projects with dates when verifiable. Cite institutional profiles and reputable coverage.
katie-bouman.example:
Professional affiliations
- 20XX–present — Caltech, Department (Role)
- Collaborations: Event Horizon Telescope (Team/Project)
katie-bouman.content: Bouman is affiliated with Caltech and collaborates with the Event Horizon Telescope team across multiple institutions.<ref name=caltechKB/> Her roles bridge electrical engineering, computing, and astronomy collaborations.<ref name=eht>https://eventhorizontelescope.org/</ref>

katie-bouman.title: Recognition
katie-bouman.reference: Recognition sections summarize notable awards, honors, and lists with year and awarding body. Use independent, reliable sources and avoid routine mentions.
katie-bouman.example:
Recognition
- 20XX — Fellowship/Prize — Awarding body
- 20XX — Included in ‘Notable list’
katie-bouman.content: She has been recognized in prominent awards and lists highlighting early‑career contributions to imaging and data science.<ref name=bbc100>https://www.bbc.com/news/world-50556280</ref> Fellowships and prizes reflect impact across disciplines.<ref name=sloan>https://sloan.org/fellowships/2024-Fellows</ref>
